hanzi-su-wiki:
挙

Значения

Подниматься, прославиться, процветать; прославлять, указывать, приводить (пример); действие, поступок, мероприятие; подносить

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Вверху — передавать жбан с вином. Рука 手 показывает, что виновник торжества вежлив, давая сначала выпить другим.

Варианты

擧, 举, 舉
purpleculture_pinyin:
jǔ
Japanese variant of 举
Японский вариант подъемника
rtega_mnemonic:
舉舉RS
挙挙		举raise, lift up, recommend
  • hand 扌/手 raising something 與/兴
koohiiStory1: The owl was asked to raise his hand if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a hand! So he made a tool that looked like a hand which he used when he needed to raise his hand. For raiseing, owl has a tool hand.
koohiiStory2: What raises mankind above others is the wisdom of an owl, the use of tools, and his hand with an opposable thumb. (compare with reputation (#1939)).
jp_example_words:
挙げる(あげる): to raise, to fly, to give (an example)
一挙に(いっきょに): at a stroke, with a single swoop
選挙(せんきょ): election
jp_readingExamples: 挙がる (あ.がる), 挙げる (あ.げる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If there’s grass on the ground and fins in your hand, you need to raise that hand up to the sky. You’re in the middle of a fisherman’s ritual, which can only be performed on grassy ground. You take fish fins from the previous year, and raise them up to the sky in order to ensure a good fishing harvest.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Feel the grass in your toes and the fins in your hand as you raise them up to the sky. See the sun glistening off the fins as you raise them up in the air.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This ritual only works in one part of the world however. It absolutely must be performed in Little Kyoto (きょ). The way Little Kyoto lines up with the sun and the sky and all that astrological junk makes it the best place for you to raise fish fins up in the air.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself going through the same process as before, only this time imagine yourself in Little Kyoto. Little Kyoto is really little, so make sure you're in the right spot.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 挙 (あげる、キョ воздевать), 拳 (こぶし、ケン кулак), 掌 (てのひら、ショウ ладонь; руководить); 手 (て、シュ рука)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thriving (兴) hand (手) rises up

Name meaning

jǔ
яп. вм. 举
Radicals: 一, ハ, 手  (ground, fins, hand, grass)
Meaning Mnemonic
If there’s grass on the ground and fins in your hand, you need to raise that hand up to the sky. You’re in the middle of a fisherman’s ritual, which can only be performed on grassy ground. You take fish fins from the previous year, and raise them up to the sky in order to ensure a good fishing harvest.
Feel the grass in your toes and the fins in your hand as you raise them up to the sky. See the sun glistening off the fins as you raise them up in the air.
Reading Mnemonic
This ritual only works in one part of the world however. It absolutely must be performed in Little Kyoto (きょ). The way Little Kyoto lines up with the sun and the sky and all that astrological junk makes it the best place for you to raise fish fins up in the air.
Imagine yourself going through the same process as before, only this time imagine yourself in Little Kyoto. Little Kyoto is really little, so make sure you're in the right spot.
